Work in Progress

Working Papers

“Intergenerational Health Mobility in Germany” (sole authored, submitted) Link to IZA Discussion Paper

“Inequality of opportunity in wealth: levels, trends, and drivers” (with Viola Hilbert and Johannes Koenig) Link to IZA Discussion Paper

“Navigating uncertainty: do Communicable diseases influence risk preferences?” (with Ulrich Schmidt, Carsten Schroeder and Johannes Seebauer) manuscript, submitted

Moral bandwidth and environmental concerns during a public health crisis: Evidence from Germany (with Julia Berazneva, Michelle McCauley, Sabine Zinn and Peter Hans Matthews) manuscript, resubmitted

“The effect of maternal education on offspring’s mental health” (with Daniel D. Schnitzlein; under review) Link to outdated SOEPpaper

“Asylum seekers and host country mental health: evidence from Germany and Switzerland” (with Prashant Bharadwaj and Stephanie Khoury) Link to working paper

Daniel Graeber's webpage. Daniel is interested in health economics, intergenerational mobility, and the formation of risk preferences. He is a postdoctoral researcher at the DIW Berlin.
